name: Holiday Inn Munich - City Centre

reviews.text: Typical Holiday Inn hotel. Spacious room, clean, full of American tourists. OK if that's what you're looking for. Pretty convenient to center of town.
reviews.title: Very American

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel with easy access (underground) to S-Bahn rail station (Rosenheimer Platz station) and Airport. No air conditioning. Grocery store nearby in undergound rail station. No "free breakfast". Breakfast was 22 Euros. Best Feature: location.
reviews.title: Good hotel with great location.

reviews.text: Very pleased with hotel. Neighborhood was nice, not too far from S-Bahn train. Hotel is adjoining a shopping center. Restaurants, shops, bars, and markets nearby and underground link to S-bahn. Only a couple of stops from famous and beautiful main StMarien Platz
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Size of Room rather small, but no problem otherwise.

reviews.text: Bed very comfortable, hotel had many luxury touches to it with amenities, mini bar (sort of high priced). I would compare this Holiday Inn on a level of Hilton or an Intercontinental. I was Extremely Impressed for it being a Holiday Inn. A little on the small size, but cozy.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Munich City Centre

reviews.text: One additional and impressive touch was that the hotel required a room key in order to turn on all power to the room. A little confusing at first when we noticed the room had no power, but quickly figured out that by the door, there was a place to slip the room key card into which enabled the power to the room. This was an interesting energy conservation tool.
reviews.title: Convenient location - Satisfactory

reviews.text: Location is the biggest plus for this property. It is very conveniently located for both business as well as pleasure activities. Multiple S-bahn (Munich's sub-urban rail network) routes stop right under the hotel - a few minutes walk from your room, and you are at the station, you don't even need to step out into the streets. Access to any part of the city, airport or sub-urban neighborhood is very convenient from this hotel.
reviews.title: Average hotel at a convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a 2-min walk away from Deutsche Museum and Isar river, a little further walk will get you to the famous Marienplatz area which is full of activities all through the day. Stretch a little more and you will be at the main station from where you can take inter-city and international trains (DB) to anywhere in Germany and neighboring countries.
reviews.title: It was acceptable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, I just forgot to talk about the hotel itself - actually there is nothing much to say about the property. It is quite ordinary budget hotel priced a little higher for its locational advantage.
reviews.title: Go again!

likes.liked: — Spotlessly clean and beds were comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend this hotel to people who want hassle-free movement while exploring Munich and would spend less time in hotel and more outside.
reviews.title: Clean and neat; great location.

likes.liked: — The location and access to transportation was excellent.
likes.disliked: — First time I've been to a European hotel where breakfast was not included.

reviews.text: I regret that I didn't have time to check out the pool and fitness center. We got into Munich quite late and chose this property because we had Priority Club points and we planned to take the train to the airport the next morning. However, there was a train accident, and we had to scurry to get a cab, which cost us around $80!
reviews.title: Not Happy

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn Munich City Centre is a basic business hotel as far as the services and facilities go, but its location as a part of a shopping complex in the heart of Munich makes it an attractive option for stays in the city.
reviews.title: Good location, basic business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable and represent european standards in size and style. Bathrooms come with a bathtub and are well lit and good.
reviews.title: Excellent base for exploring Munich

reviews.text: Finding places to eat or places to shop for amenities, food items, clothes is easy as the hotel is a part of a small shopping centre located in the same building.
reviews.title: Clean and Efficient

reviews.text: I booked our stay at this hotel through Last Minute and found it a fantastic hotel. It was right on the S Bahn station for Rosenheimer Platz which meant it had excellent links to the rest of the city as well as the airport. We didn't use the restaurant, prefering to eat in townand save money by shopping at Hit supermarket which is in the same complex. There is also a 24 hour garage which carries groaceries less than 30 seconds from the front door. The staff were helpful and polite at all hours of the day. The room was clean, the bathroom excellent with a powerful shower Other reviewers have mentioned the lack of English language channels. As this is a hotel in Germany not England we didn't see this as an issue. The swimming Pool was open and good, with plenty of space. If using this hotel it is possible to completely rely on the S Bahn and the U bahn system. We purchased a partner tageskarte for the Innerraum. This cost 9 euros, was valid for upto five people until 6 the next morning. There are numerous food establishments within walking distance covering traditional Bavarian food, to Mexican, Afghan, Italian and Turkish. I would have no doubt about recommending this hotel to other travellers
reviews.title: Oktoberfest

likes.liked: — Grocery stores underneath hotel, clean rooms, nice safe neighborhood

reviews.text: We spent two nights as part of a tour group. Hotel was clean, rooms good, and staff courteous. Breakfast buffet was excellent. While we did not utilize it, the hotel is located next to subway access, so getting around town would be easy. I would have no qualms about staying here in the future.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

likes.disliked: — The internet costs money (though it is easily accessed in the room)

reviews.text: This was a business trip, a long one and although I have another 2 nights left, I feel I have had enough time in the hotel to give an accurate review.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Suprised

likes.disliked: — Prices of mini-bar and Internet. In room entertainment.

reviews.text: Planning the area was easy; I have stayed in this part of the city before, Rosenheimer Platz, close enough to Marien Platz, but not too close to be "touristy". The two main choices were the Hilton, Munich City or the Holiday Inn. The Holiday Inn came in a bit lower on the daily rate (company policy prevails). I had also stayed in this hotel before, when it was still called "The Forum".
reviews.title: Excellent city centre hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at Holiday inn with my best friend for 4 days. We booked a twin room from hotel's website 3 months before our trip, therefore we payed 80euro per day without breakfast, which is very cheap.
reviews.title: Best Place to stay in Munich for tourism

reviews.text: The hotel is at a very convienient spot if you visit munich for tourism. The subway is UNDER the hotel, you need 5 minutes walk to arrive at the platform and 5 minutes to arrive at the center of Munich. In the area of the subway there is a supermarket and a bakery, where we bought every day sandwiches and fresh juices.
reviews.title: a welcoming inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think that the breakfast in the hotel costs around 15euros per person which is quite expensive.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: The room was a "Holiday Inn" room, clean with a big bathroom and a bathtub. Our room was on the 6th floor(priority club floor) and it was very quiet.
reviews.title: Great Location, Fantastic transport links

reviews.text: It even had coffee maker with free sugar and milk, therefore if you go downstairs in the subway (2minutes walk) and buy sandwich and juices and drink coffee in the room, you don't need to pay 15euro for breakfast.
reviews.title: Convenient, reliable holiday hotel
Les Miserables
reviews.text: I stayed here at the end of September during Oktoberfest. The asking rate was 300 Euros at the time. I guess this is why we accumulate our Priority Club points--thank God I was able to use my points. Well, I could see how someone who landed this hotel with Priceline might be happy. The rooms are large by European city standards, and the beds comfortable (with a pillow menu, which I appreciated since I prefer firm synthetic pillows).

One thing I didn't realize when I first arrived was that the hotel is connected with the S-Bahn if you get off at the right escalator. When coming from the airport, roll your luggage towards the front end of the train, take the escalator on the very end, then follow the signs. When coming from the HBF (main train station), go towards the back of the train, and follow the same directions.
reviews.title: Excellent location, clean and comfy room

likes.liked: — Location, convenient to mass transit, good-sized and comfortable room, clean bathroom
likes.disliked: — No in-room safe (but that's just nitpicking!)

reviews.text: I used my Priority Club Visa to check in--which I use only with Intercontinental Hotel Group hotels (such as Holiday Inns). There was nothing to charge since my room was paid with Priority Club points, however. No sooner did I get to my room, that my domestic partner called from the U.S. to tell me that the credit card wanted to speak with me. No problem, I thought. I went back down to the lobby where I met my German friends and asked the receptionist to call the credit card # collect. He refused to do it (no language barrier--I was with native German speakers--he just refused to do it).
reviews.title: Great location, large clean rooms

reviews.text: When I got home, I called them and found out there was $150 in unauthorized charges. They had to cancel the card and send another one. I never so much as touched anything in the minibar, made a single outside call, or charged a single minute of internet time, or spend anything else there. I never gave anyone else my credit card #, so it must have come from there. If you will click on my User ID, you will see that I'm very well-traveled and go to hotels around the world. I've never had anything like this ever happen to me. I have Gold status with Hilton, Intercontinental Hotel Group, and Starwood.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: This hotel stay reminded me of the Les Miserables song "Master of the House." Breakfast would have cost over $30, as would a day of internet usage! Fortunately, as you leave the hotel towards the S-Bahn, there is a cafe with affordable breakfast, and there is an affordable internet cafe across the street. Even a bottle of water would have cost over $10! These charges were much higher than at the 5* Hotel Bellevue in Bern where I had stayed a week earlier. Plus, the indoor swimming pool wasn't even in working order
reviews.title: Very Solid American Hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here and reviewed this hotel previously.
reviews.title: Return Visit

reviews.text: It is a good clean hotel, staff friendly and ideally suited being only 20 mins walk from Marienplatz. Underneath the hotel is a coffee shop, supermarket, S-Bahn Station and secure parking (17 euro per night).
reviews.title: What you expect - good for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My disappointment is that my previous visit was paid for using loyalty club points - I received a super room, city view, city info - nothing was an issue. On this occasion I paid for the room and had to ask for the double room I'd booked not the twin I was allocated (10 minute delay). I had to ask for city info (out of date) and the view from the room was the concert hall opposite (view?)
reviews.title: Very good hotel - poor front desk services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This trip the hotel 'met' my expectations where as previously it had exceeded them. Because of this I will try another chain next time.
reviews.title: Good Value and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here when I visited with friends for Octoberfest. It is a Holiday Inn, so you know what you're getting. Clean room, functional and clean bathroom. Big bonus is its proximity to the S bahn station straight from the airport. For this reason I would stay here again and recommend it for tourists as everything is such a short train ride away on the excellent Munich train system.
reviews.title: Not the best service or room

reviews.text: this is a great place to stay if you want to get a train direct from the airport into town and then arrive in your hotel without coming out the underground. The hotel is above a small shopping centre and close to the city centre. The hotel informed me that I had been upgraded to superior and free internet access. However on arrival was told that "superior" meant "heigher" and the internet access was via a network cable only and not the wifi that was provided by another company. As all my details were on smartphone and my only option was to pay €22 a day!
reviews.title: okay, great location, but a few hassles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were small niggles, beds not made up properly, no room safe as asked, (although free safe deposit in lobby - but you have to wait in a queue as staff have to open it) sheets not changed, tea and coffee facilities not refreshed, shower is above a bath with a low ceiling and I'm over 6 foot tall.
reviews.title: Not very good
Decent hotel, OK location, very good buffet, but lacking character.
reviews.text: Probably no worse than other Holiday Inns I've stayed in but other than location there is little to recommend it. Staff were attentive, breakfast good.
Small basic rooms. Rooms quite outdated. Not very comfy bed and pillows. But good thing they had water boiler. No bathroom slippers though. 20 mins walk to Marienplatz.
reviews.title: worth every penny!

reviews.text: Decent hotel, OK location, very good buffet, but totally lacking character.
reviews.title: Good service in good location

reviews.text: Location and transport access are the strong points for this hotel. Just two to four stops to the city centre and main railway station, yet in a fairly quiet part of town. The S8 metro line takes you directly from the airport to the hotel's Rosenplatz metro station which is a real boon.The fact that one can walk to the metro without walking outside is a real bonus in wet weather.
reviews.title: Convenient and functional

reviews.text: The hotel has all the fuctionality of a Holiday Inn. The room was of reasonable size for Europe. The room was clean,modern and quiet and the bathroom well equiped. The provision of a coffee/tea maker was welcome as was the iron and ironing board.
reviews.title: Just another Holiday Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was a fairly large spread with hot and cold stations and good value for money. We were pleased that the offering was not limited to cereals,eggs,breads and coffee. due to high season wedid have to wait to find a table, but it was not too inordinately long.
reviews.title: Very convenient place to stay in Munich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was passable but one wouldn't expect much better in a 3 star property.The bar was again functional with an open outdoor area. We were impressed by the waitress who managed to provide us cocktails which were not on the menu and that to at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: DONT BOOK THIS

reviews.text: The front office were also helpful when we informed them that we could not contact our travel agent. They phoned up three times to various people and managed to connect us to the concerned person at the travel agent, and that too at no extra charge. Only at checkout were we delayed as there were several checkouts and only one receptionist.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn is predictable, makes it easy to choose hotel
excellent
reviews.text: this hotel has recently been re-branded with the new Holiday Inn logos and looks fresh and very tidy

reviews.title: Good hotel, convenient location
reviews.text: reception is bright and airy and the reception staff very friendly and helpful - we were provided with maps and guides to the area and directions to the underground when we booked in.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel near the city center
reviews.text: the nearest underground station is under the hotel.

reviews.title: Love That Pillow Menu
reviews.text: the rooms are big and bright with good quality fittings and fixtures and a big bed, LCD tv and a pillow menu (wild)

reviews.title: Not in the city centre !
reviews.text: if you can, ask reception for a room with a city view
Service very good, room typical Holiday Inn, could make coffe, no noises.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast very rich.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for a Munich visit

reviews.text: Most important is the perfect location of this hotel.
reviews.title: Good location and well appointed

reviews.text: Near the city center, about 10 minutes walk to Marienplatz, plus the metro station is right beneath where you can go anywhere even in the airport.
reviews.title: Housekeeping is not so good...

reviews.text: Cons. No free WiFi and rates very expensive.
reviews.title: Superb hotel!!!

aka: Holiday Inn Munich - City Centre Hotel Munich
description: Located in the heart of Munich and opposite the Cultural Centre Gasteig , the Hotel Holiday Inn Munich City Centre is ideally situated for business and leisure travellers. Just 10 minutes walk from Marienplatz and Viktualienmarkt or 5 minutes to the German Museum. The Hotel Holiday Inn Munich-City Centre provides just the right space for you. Our 582 modern styled bedrooms have been thoughtfully designed to cater for a range of different requirements; an overnight stay, a holiday or a corporate event. All rooms of the Hotel Holiday Inn Munich - City Centre are air-conditioned and have highspeed internet. Coffee and Tea are complimentary throughout your stay. All guests have free use of the hotel s indoor swimming pool. A public fitness centre with sauna, steam bath, solarium and masseur is within the same building (special conditions for hotel guests). Several jogging trails lead from the Hotel Holiday Inn Munich City Centre along the river Isar to the English Garden.The Hotel Holiday Inn Munich - City Centre is easy to access whether by car, bus or train. The train station Rosenheimerplatz is situated within the same building complex and provides direct access to the airport, the main train station and the ICM Trade Fair Grounds.With our Check In & Check Out Terminals you can check in and out with ease. Uncomplicated and cashless! .We look forward to welcoming you!
